com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl

Class HighPerformanceLoggerConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl.HighPerformanceLoggerConfiguration

  • public final class HighPerformanceLoggerConfiguration
extends Object
    Class responsible for providing configuration for the high performance logger.

    • Field Detail

      • CONFIGURATION_FILE_NAME

        public static final String CONFIGURATION_FILE_NAME
        Name of the high performance logging subsystem configuration file. The search path when loading the configuration file is in order of preference:
        • The current working directory as specified by the user.dir system property
        • The classpath as visible to the current thread's context class loader
        • The classpath as visible to this class's class loader.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENABLED_PROPERTY

        public static final String ENABLED_PROPERTY
        The name of the property used to control whether high performance logging is enabled or not. Even if high performance logging is enabled by the application it can be disabled explicitly via configuration.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_FILE_LENGTH_PROPERTY

        public static final String MAX_FILE_LENGTH_PROPERTY
        The name of the property used to specify the maximum length of the currently live log file before it is rolled over.
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_MAX_FILE_LENGTH, Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MAX_FILE_LENGTH

        public static final long DEFAULT_MAX_FILE_LENGTH
        The default maximum logging file length (2GB). The log file is rolled automatically before it reaches this limit so that no individual log file ever exceeds it.
        See Also:
        MAX_FILE_LENGTH_PROPERTY, Constant Field Values

      • MAX_TOTAL_FILE_LENGTH_PROPERTY

        public static final String MAX_TOTAL_FILE_LENGTH_PROPERTY
        The name of the property used to specify the maximum total file length for all the high performance log files before deleting the oldest files.

        Files will be deleted until the summation of all their file lengths plus the maximum file length is equal or below the maximum total file length.

        See Also:
        DEFAULT_MAX_TOTAL_FILE_LENGTH, Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MAX_TOTAL_FILE_LENGTH

        public static final long DEFAULT_MAX_TOTAL_FILE_LENGTH
        The default maximum total file length (0).
        See Also:
        MAX_TOTAL_FILE_LENGTH_PROPERTY, Constant Field Values

      • MIN_BUFFER_SIZE_PROPERTY

        public static final String MIN_BUFFER_SIZE_PROPERTY
        The name of the property used to specify the minimum asynchronous buffer size in terms of outstanding log events.

        The buffer is shared by all log event producing threads and consumed by the single logger appender thread. A larger buffer size decreases the probability of a producing thread being blocked by a slow consumer at the expense of pre-allocated memory footprint.

        Note that the size of the actual pre-allocated buffer is the next power of two above the specified minimum value.

        See Also:
        DEFAULT_LOG_BUFFER_SIZE, Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_LOG_BUFFER_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_LOG_BUFFER_SIZE
        The default asynchronous buffer size (10000).
        See Also:
        MIN_BUFFER_SIZE_PROPERTY, Constant Field Values

      • MIN_BUFFER_ENTRY_SIZE_PROPERTY

        public static final String MIN_BUFFER_ENTRY_SIZE_PROPERTY
        The name of the property used to specify the number of bytes initially reserved for each asynchronous buffer log entry.

        Logging events are serialized in the producing thread before being copied to the asynchronous buffer. However, if during copying it is detected that the target byte array is insufficient then a new one is allocated (and never freed).

        See Also:
        DEFAULT_LOG_ENTRY_SIZE_BYTES, Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_LOG_ENTRY_SIZE_BYTES

        public static final int DEFAULT_LOG_ENTRY_SIZE_BYTES
        The default asychronous buffer log entry size in bytes (500).
        See Also:
        MIN_BUFFER_ENTRY_SIZE_PROPERTY, Constant Field Values

      • LEVEL_PROPERTY

        public static final String LEVEL_PROPERTY
        The name of the property used to specify the default logging level for all high performance loggers.
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_LEVEL, Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • HighPerformanceLoggerConfiguration

        public HighPerformanceLoggerConfiguration()
        Constructor.

        A default configuration is loaded, followed by properties from the CONFIGURATION_FILE_NAME (if any). The configuration file need only be available somewhere in the classpath.

        Throws:
        HighPerformanceLoggerConfigurationException - If any configuration errors are detected.

      • getIsEnabled

        public boolean getIsEnabled()
        Return whether the high performance logging subsystem is enabled.

        Existence of a configuration file does not guarantee that it is enabled as it can be disabled via configuration.

        Returns:
        True if the high performance logging subsystem is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ENABLED_PROPERTY

      • setIsEnabled

        public void setIsEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
        Set whether the high performance logging subsystem is enabled.

        This method has no effect unless called prior to the first ILogger being obtained.

        Parameters:
        isEnabled - True to enabled, false to disable.
